name: Sunday Brunch: Fried Apple Rings
description: I ran out of time last week to make Marion Cunningham's fried apple rings, which I had wanted to serve with her oatmeal pancakes. I couldn't get them out of my head, though—apple slices fried golden in bacon fat? I had to know more—and ended up making them this week.
recipeIngredient: 2 firm apples, cored and sliced into rings 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick (about 4 rings per apple—discard top and bottom rings)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat bacon fat in 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Using tongs, lay apple rings in hot fat and cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with sugar turn over with tongs. Cook until sugar has melted and apple rings are golden on both sides, about 2 minutes longer. Serve hot with oatmeal, pancakes, or toast.
